Player History
Signed as a free agent by Oakland on 4/3/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $1,164,000 per year...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1985, off Dan Quisenberry (KC)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/16/1985, off Scott McGregor (NYG)...
Traded from Oakland to Seattle on 4/18/1985 (Going to SEA: 3B Gary Gaetti. Going to OAK: RF Dave Henderson, SS Darnell Coles)...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,392,857 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 6/4/1986 with a Torn Abdominal Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
10/10/1986: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $3,750,000 per year, for 4 years.
Drove in 6 runs against Texas on 4/7/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/25/1987, hitting .462 with 3 HR, 16 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1987, hitting .326 with 8 HR, 26 RBI...
Drove in 7 runs against Oakland on 8/17/1989...
Signed as a free agent by Los Angeles on 2/27/1991 to a 1-year deal worth $750,000 per year...
